actions-list.actionItem: The House adjourned pursuant to a previous special order. The next meeting is scheduled for 9:00 a.m. on February 13, 2025.
On motion to adjourn Agreed to by voice vote.
Mr. Grothman moved that the House do now adjourn.
The House has concluded all anticipated legislative business and has proceeded to Special Order speeches.
The House resumed with one minute speeches.
Mr. Lawler asked unanimous consent that when the House adjourns today, it adjourn to meet at 9:00 a.m. on February 13. Agreed to without objection.
The House proceeded with further one minute speeches.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On passage Passed by the Yeas and Nays: 212
actions-list.actionItem: 208 (Roll no. 41).

actions-list.header: On motion to recommit Failed by the Yeas and Nays: 205
actions-list.actionItem: 213 (Roll no. 40).
The previous question on the motion to recommit was ordered pursuant to clause 2(b) of rule XIX.
Ms. Jacobs moved to recommit to the Committee on the Judiciary.
The previous question was ordered pursuant to the rule.
The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H.R. 77.
Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 77 with 1 hour of general debate. Motion to recommit allowed. Bill is closed to amendments.

Considered under the provisions of rule H. Res. 122. H.R. 77 â€” "To amend chapter 8 of title 5, United States Code, to provide for en bloc consideration in resolutions of disapproval for "midnight rules", and for other purposes."

The House received a message from the Clerk. Pursuant to the permission granted in Clause 2(h) of Rule II of the Rules of the U.S. House of Representatives, the Clerk notified the House that he had received the following message from the Secretary of the Senate on February 12, 2025, at 11:14 a.m.: Appointments: Commission on Security and Cooperation in Europe; Finance Committee as Congressional advisers on trade policy and negotiations to international conferences, meetings and negotiation sessions relating to trade agreements; Joint Committee on Taxation; and Washington's Farewell Address.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of February 12.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is subject to the call of the Chair.
The House proceeded with one minute speeches which by direction of the Chair, would be limited to 15 per side of the aisle.
The Chair designated Mr. Wilson of SC to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal.  Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of February 12.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is scheduled for 12:00 P.M. today.
The House proceeded with Morning-Hour Debate. At the conclusion of Morning-Hour, the House will recess until 12:00 p.m. for the start of legislative business.
The Speaker designated the Honorable Mariannette Miller-Meeks to act as Speaker pro tempore for today.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
